name: Leila Sterman
quote: We’re excited to finally build everything we’ve learned from mediated deposit into a simple tool, not a dozen workarounds, that enables every library to make self-archiving not just the right thing, but the easy thing, for every author.
img_alt: Black-haired light-skinned woman laughing against a bright blue background.

name: Tina Baich
role: Senior Associate Dean for Scholarly Communication & Content Strategies
quote: InstantILL is community-owned infrastructure that improves our services, helps reduce dependency on subscriptions, and advances equitable access to information
img_alt: Light-skinned woman with brown hair wearing glasses and a chunky necklace in a library.

name: Peter Bae
role: Assistant University Librarian for Scholarly Collections Services at Princeton University
quote: Finding an OA article is not an easy task even for librarians whose job is getting materials for their patrons. With InstantILL, finding what’s available on the net has become very easy. InstantILL has greatly helped our new international resource sharing initiative, RSCVD, in responding to Covid-19.
img_alt: Headshot of Asian man wearing glasses and a tie.
affiliation: International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA)

name: Iryna Kuchma
quote: ShareYourPaper removes the challenge of depositing the right version at the right time that many researchers and repository managers face. Open Access Button facilitates free access to journal articles. It’s critical that these essential infrastructures be free, open source, and built with the community!
img_alt: Blue-eyed, fair-skinned woman looking over her shoulder with arms crossed.

name: Sarah Wipperman
quote: Figuring out if a paper can go into a repository is one of the biggest barriers to Open Access. That’s why we worked with the Open Access Button to turn our on-campus dataset into a global service that simplifies and explains the process to authors and libraries!
img_alt: Black and white photo of a light-skinned woman.

name: Ashley Farley
role: Program Officer of Knowledge and Research Services
quote: Open enables our grantees and their communities to better fight inequity and help everyone lead healthy, productive lives. That’s why we’re investing in open tools that support making open simpler and more equitable. In OA.Works, we’ve found a partner who shares our values of optimism, collaboration, rigor, and innovation.
img_alt: Headshot of a smiling woman in a white ruffled top with fair skin and burgundy hair.

name: Heather Joseph
quote: This team has consistently created resources and community central to the open sharing of knowledge. It’s been a real pleasure to watch OA.Works grow into an important provider of high-quality tools supporting open access to knowledge.
img_alt: A smiling woman wearing glasses and a grey cardigan, with her hair done up in a bun. The photo is taken in a sunny yard, against a fence covered in foliage.

name: Madeleine Thompson
quote: We have a very small staff, and SYP has been pivotal to us in advancing our Open Access goals.  The tool is so easy to use, and the OA.Works team has been terrific to work with as we continue to improve our processes.
img_alt: A woman smiling, posing in front of the sea in a cardigan and dotted top.
